name: heat production, wood chips from industry, at furnace 300kW | heat, district or industrial, other than natural gas | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/8938/documentation

This activity represents the combustion of wood chips from industry in Switzerland. Air emission factors as well as the boiler efficiency represent average annual operation including start and stop (warm-up and shut-down). Therefore, emission data will be higher and efficiency will be lower than rated values provided by manufacturers. The inventory shall be considered as being representative also for boilers with nominal capacities in the approximate range of 70 kW to 500 kW. ;;[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets:; - heat production, hardwood chips from forest, at furnace 300kW, CH, 2000 - 2001 (fb44c735-ae61-4922-ba28-6689f7cebc97)]

from delivery of wood chips

This activity describes the combustion of wood chips from industry. Included are the infrastructure, the wood requirements (hardwood chips from forest), the emissions to air, the electricity needed for operation, and the disposal of the ashes.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/353:Steam and air conditioning supply/3530:Steam and air conditioning supply

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Key emission factors PM, CO, NMVOC, CH4, NOx as well as the average annual efficiency have been updated using the latest available information. Other emission data are from the second half of the 1990Â´s.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Represents average Swiss conditions and could be used for Europe as well.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Boiler of average technology available on the Swiss market.

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=CH
The numbers used in the mathematical relation refer to the input of one MJ of fuel with the heat output depending on the efficiency of the furnace. Using the "scling factor" (inverse of the efficiency) allows for scaling of the amount of the reference product to 1.
